keyword: how many calories is in a taco
title: How Many Calories Are in a Taco?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a taco with this breakdown of a standard beef taco, including macros, sodium, and easy variations for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Taco?
assumptions: Standard soft corn tortilla taco with 1 oz cooked ground beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomato, 1 oz cheddar cheese; no sour cream or salsa.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ingredients, portion size, preparation, and brand; fast-food versions may differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical beef taco contains about 210 calories and 11 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Use grilled chicken instead of beef

faqs.q: How many calories is in a taco from a fast-food chain?
faqs.a: Typically 200-300 kcal, depending on fillings like beef or chicken.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a standard taco?
faqs.a: About 15 g carbs, 11 g protein, 12 g fat per taco.
Yes, around 380 mg per taco due to cheese and seasonings.

faqs.q: How does a vegetarian taco compare?
faqs.a: A bean-based taco has similar calories (~200 kcal) but more fiber and less fat.

faqs.q: Does the tortilla type affect calories?
faqs.a: Corn tortillas are lower (~50 kcal each) than flour (~90 kcal each).
